db:abstract.db:para: The QLowEnergyConnectionParameters class is used when requesting or reporting an update of the parameters of a Bluetooth LE connection.
This class was introduced in Qt 5.7.

db:section.db:title: Detailed Description
db:section.db:para: The connection parameters influence how often a master and a slave device synchronize with each other. In general, a lower connection interval and latency means faster communication, but also higher power consumption. How these criteria should be weighed against each other is highly dependent on the concrete use case.

db:section.db:title: QLowEnergyConnectionParameters::QLowEnergyConnectionParameters()
db:section.db:para: Constructs a new object of this class. All values are initialized to valid defaults.

db:section.db:title: QLowEnergyConnectionParameters::QLowEnergyConnectionParameters(const QLowEnergyConnectionParameters &other)
db:section.db:para: Constructs a new object of this class that is a copy of other.

db:section.db:title: int QLowEnergyConnectionParameters::latency() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the slave latency of the connection.

db:section.db:title: double QLowEnergyConnectionParameters::maximumInterval() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the maximum connection interval in milliseconds. The default is 4000.

db:note.db:para: If this object was emitted via QLowEnergyController::connectionUpdated(), then this value is the same as minimumInterval() and refers to the actual connection interval.

db:section.db:title: double QLowEnergyConnectionParameters::minimumInterval() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the minimum connection interval in milliseconds. The default is 7.5.

db:note.db:para: If this object was emitted via QLowEnergyController::connectionUpdated(), then this value is the same as maximumInterval() and refers to the actual connection interval.

db:section.db:title: void QLowEnergyConnectionParameters::setIntervalRange(double minimum, double maximum)
db:section.db:para: Sets the range in which the connection interval should be. The actual value will be decided by the controller. Both minimum and maximum are given in milliseconds. If maximum is smaller than minimum, it will be set to the value of minimum. The smallest possible connection interval is 7.5 milliseconds, the largest one is 4000 milliseconds.

db:section.db:title: void QLowEnergyConnectionParameters::setLatency(int latency)
db:section.db:para: Sets the slave latency of the connection (that is, the number of connection events that a slave device is allowed to ignore) to latency. The minimum value is 0, the maximum is 499.

db:section.db:title: void QLowEnergyConnectionParameters::setSupervisionTimeout(int timeout)
db:section.db:para: Sets the link supervision timeout to timeout milliseconds. There are several constraints on this value: It must be in the range [100,32000] and it must be larger than (1 + latency()) * 2 * maximumInterval().

db:section.db:title: int QLowEnergyConnectionParameters::supervisionTimeout() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the link supervision timeout of the connection in milliseconds.

db:section.db:title: QLowEnergyConnectionParameters &QLowEnergyConnectionParameters::operator=(const QLowEnergyConnectionParameters &other)
db:section.db:para: Makes this object a copy of other and returns the new value of this object.
